title: HPD: 2 wounded in shootings in SW Houston
content:
HOUSTON – Two males were wounded in two shootings that investigators believe are related in southwest Houston early Monday.
According to the Houston Police Department, officers responded just before 3 a.m. to a call of a shooting on West Fuqua at Alrover.
When HPD arrived they found a Mustang crashed into a light pole and a 14-year old male shot in the buttocks and arm, police said.
Police said a short time later another shooting call came in on Dalmation and Littleford where another male was found shot in the leg.
Both were transported to a local hospital and are expected to survive, police said.
Police said they believe the shootings are related, but are getting conflicting statements from witnesses.
HPD stopped a suspicious Honda with three males inside who were found to be armed, but unknown yet if they are the suspects in the shooting.
